name: Exclusion of interest on bonds for private nonprofit educational facilities
objective: The baseline tax system generally would tax all income under the regular tax rate schedule. It would not allow preferentially low (or zero) tax rates to apply to certain types or sources of income. In contrast, under current law interest earned on State and local Government bonds issued to finance the construction of facilities used by private nonprofit educational institutions is not taxed.
categories: Tax Expenditures - Education, Training, Employment, and Social Services
